natural problem: On Tuesday, I worked $t+1$ hours and earned $3t-3$ dollars per hour. My friend Andrew worked $3t-5$ hours but only earned $t+2$ dollars an hour. At the end of the day, I had earned two dollars more than he had. What is the value of $t$?
natural solution: Since I earned two dollars more than Andrew, we know that $$(t+1) (3t-3) = (3t-5)(t+2) + 2 \qquad\Rightarrow\qquad 3t^2-3 = 3t^2 + t -8 .$$Simplifying gives $t = \boxed{5}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes t :: real
assumes h0 : "(t + 1) * (3 * t - 3) = (3 * t - 5) * (t + 2) + 2"
shows  "t = 5"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 On Tuesday, I worked $t+1$ hours and earned $3t-3$ dollars per hour. My friend Andrew worked $3t-5$ hours but only earned $t+2$ dollars an hour. At the end of the day, I had earned two dollars more than he had. What is the value of $t$? The final Answer is 5
 ### Proof
 Since I earned two dollars more than Andrew, we know that $$(t+1) (3t-3) = (3t-5)(t+2) + 2 \qquad\Rightarrow\qquad 3t^2-3 = 3t^2 + t -8 .$$Simplifying gives $t = \boxed{5}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes t :: real
assumes h0 : "(t + 1) * (3 * t - 3) = (3 * t - 5) * (t + 2) + 2"
shows  "t = 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the real number $t$ that satisfies the equation $(t + 1) \cdot (3t - 3) = (3t - 5) \cdot (t + 2) + 2$. The final answer is $t = 5$.
